title: 15+ Stylish Tattoo Fonts for Women in 2025
description: Are you on the lookout for all of the best tattoo fonts for women? If you are, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup of feminine tattoo fonts.
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Are you on the lookout for all of the best tattoo fonts for women? If you are, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup of feminine tattoo fonts.
text: Are you on the lookout for all of the best tattoo fonts for women? If you are, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup below! There’s something about tattoos that makes flaunting self-expression a little more exciting. Whether it’s wearing your heart out or making a statement, tattoos are staples in individualism. As such, this aesthetic has carried over into the digital world. With fonts copying nearly everything where art is present, typefaces have managed to breathe life into the works we put out and the texts we write. Also, check out our blog on the best free tattoo fonts for artistic designs. Let’s go over the best tattoo fonts for women available online today! UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Tattoo Fonts for Women you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 15+ Stylish Tattoo Fonts for Women in 2025 1. Chica Script Font  Chica Script Font. Image Credits: Creative Market Chica is an elegant tattoo script that’s intentionally designed to highlight words you want to keep on your skin forever! Available in both uppercase and lowercase letters, this stylish tattoo font bundle should make it easier for you to convey whatever message you want to put out. We liked how this font pack includes 20 ligatures, a bonus “swashes” font, and three tattoo illustrations. The illustrations come in vector and PNG files while the swashes are in a folder as individual PNG files. Not to mention, it’s very easy to install and use! 2. Strong West – Retro Tattoo Font Strong West – Retro Tattoo Font. Image Credits: Envato Elements Strong West does a fantastic job sporting a strong headline aesthetic, while also doubling as a striking retro tattoo font. Featuring serifs and added decorative elements, this beautiful font bundle tops our list of the best tattoo fonts for women. Once inked, consider using tattoo photography to capture the fine lines and feminine flair of this font, this helps you preserve and share that design beautifully. Depending on your project’s theme, you can also use this font for logos, headers, posters, and other designs that demand attention. Within the font pack, you’ll find uppercase letters, numbers, punctuation marks, and comprehensive multilingual support. 3. BRADWICK – Tattoo Font BRADWICK – Tattoo Font. Image Credits: Envato Elements BRADWICK is another stellar font bundle that doesn’t stray too far from Strong West. Referred to as a vintage sailor font, not only is this a great tattoo font, but it’ll also work effectively as a signage and headline. It’s been optimized for large projects as well so we enjoyed using this for posters, billboards, and more. While the letters are all capitalized, this tattoo font pack also includes numbers and punctuation marks. It’s easy to install and is compatible with both Mac and Windows too. We were able to access this font through Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and Microsoft Word. 4. Puerto Playful Tattoo Font Puerto Playful Tattoo Font. Image Credits: Envato Elements Puerto is a playful font bundle with decorative elements, making it a great visual solution for a variety of things–tattoo-inspired or not. Though it only has uppercase letters, this font’s style makes it more flexible than most tattoo fonts in our list. As a tattoo-inspired font, it carries those aesthetics but it’s not dedicated to those either. Hence, we consider it suitable for any theme as the font for a logo, poster, branding effort, advertisement, and more. 5. Buttercake | Monoscript font Buttercake | Monoscript font. Image Credits: Envato Elements A dainty script font bundle, Buttercake does a tremendous job of keeping an amicable aesthetic while remaining classy and versatile. Packed with uppercase and lowercase letters, alternates, numbers, and punctuation marks, this pastry-inspired tattoo visual is perfect for more than just your everyday headline. We found it simple to install this font pack on Mac and Windows. It features multilingual support for 16 languages and is provided in TTF, OTF, and WOFF formats. Furthermore, we enjoyed using this font for posters, logos, banners, t-shirts, packaging, magazines, and more. It’s a stylish and versatile font that’s suitable for a wide range of projects. 6. Desirable Calligraphy Desirable Calligraphy. Image Credits: Creative Market Tons of calligraphy-centric tattoos are all the rave today, and Desirable Calligraphy is proof of that. Loaded with multi-lingual supports, this beautiful font bundle is apt for several design projects. From marketing to personal efforts, the list is long with what you can do here. 7. Reina Neue Reina Neue. Image Credits: MyFonts Are you looking for a font pack that has a lot to offer? Reina Neue provides bang for your buck. With over 40 elegant serifs to choose from, it’s nearly impossible to still not find what you’re looking for here. 8. Fire Needle – Tattoo Parlor Label Font Fire Needle – Tattoo Parlor Label Font. Image Credits: Envato Elements Fire Needle is another terrific pick. Referred to as a vintage label font, this serif-like bundle comes with uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as numerals and punctuation marks. Great for art cards, quote cards, and social media materials, this tattoo-inspired aesthetic is a versatile contender. 9. STRATES VINTAGE TATTOO FONT STRATES VINTAGE TATTOO FONT. Image Credits: Envato Elements One of the more aesthetically pleasing options on the list is STRATES VINTAGE. Sporting heart-like curves in the middle section of each character, this contender is perfect for more than just tattoo-inspired ideas. From headlines and marketing materials to branding efforts and creative projects, there are plenty of things you can do with this pick. 10. Just Cosmic Font + Logos Just Cosmic Font + Logos. Image Credits: Creative Market Just Cosmic is an elegant serif font that sports beautiful ligatures and swashes. Perfect for one-word tattoo ideas, this tasteful font offering comes with capital and small letters, making it a great option for plenty of designs and projects. 11. La Pirata – Vintage Tattoo Font La Pirata – Vintage Tattoo Font. Image Credits: Envato Elements La Pirata is a playful tattoo-inspired font option. Also packing mid-section decorative elements, this pretty tattoo font isn’t only a spectacular tattoo font option, but it’ll make for a great aesthetic for marketing materials and signages too. 12. Displaying Bad Luck Displaying Bad Luck. Image Credits: Envato Elements It may be called Bad Luck, but the only karma we’re sensing here is fortune and good vibes! An old-school tattoo display type font, this all-uppercase font offering is a feast for the eyes! 13. Bad Sailor Typeface Bad Sailor Typeface.Image Credits: Creative Market We can’t get enough of vintage-like font bundles, and Bad Sailor should help prove that. A terrific tattoo font inspiration, this decorative contender is approbated for plenty of designs too! From quote tattoos to advertising efforts, this pick’s a keeper! 14. Lordish Blackletter Lordish Blackletter. Image Credits: Creative Market Who says blackletter fonts are for men only? Lordish is every inch a black letter font but with a classy twist! Part medieval and part serif, this beautiful typeface is a combination of plenty of elements! It comes in 3 weights, too, ensuring that you can pick whatever is best for your project or tattoo! 15. Tattoo God Tattoo God. Image Credits: MyFonts In the mood for a wavy aesthetic? Tattoo God makes great use of a handwritten font. Stylishly designed to highlight capital letters, there are also plenty of designs you can complete with this option! 16. Wildstyle – Chicano Tattoo Font Wildstyle. Image Credits: Envato Elements Wildstyle is a bold and elegant font that perfectly captures the essence of Chicano tattoo art with a stylish flair. Featuring decorative swashes and calligraphic details, this versatile font is ideal for tattoo-inspired logos, headlines, posters, and other eye-catching designs. The font pack includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, punctuation, and multilingual support, along with unique swash and alternate styles for added creative possibilities. Stylish & Pretty Tattoo Fonts for Women Summary Tattoos are cool regardless of what others say about them. At the end of the day, getting tattoos is just another form of self-expression, especially if it doesn’t horribly affect your daily life. If you end up getting yourself inked with any of the fonts we listed in this feature, let us know! All in all, the best tattoo fonts for women are stellar finds, each designed to help bring out a statement. Whatever message, idea, or story you want to tell the world, we hope our roundup of all of the best picks in the category helps streamline your search! What’s your favorite font bundle here? Share it with us in the comment section! Frequently Asked Questions How to find the perfect tattoo font? To find the perfect tattoo font, consider the message and style you want to convey, ensure legibility, and think about size and placement. Simplicity often works best, and consulting a tattoo artist can ensure lasting results. Is lettering a tattoo style? Lettering is a tattoo style and one of the oldest forms of tattooing. It's popular for its ability to transform meaningful words or phrases into permanent art, allowing personal expressions to be beautifully inked onto the skin. Can tattoos be classy? Yes, tattoos can be classy, though "classy" is subjective. Opt for clean, minimalist designs or black-and-grey styles, and choose a skilled artist who excels in precision and aesthetics to create a timeless, sophisticated tattoo. html:
Are you on the lookout for all of the best tattoo fonts for women? If you are, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup below!

There’s something about tattoos that makes flaunting self-expression a little more exciting.

Whether it’s wearing your heart out or making a statement, tattoos are staples in individualism. As such, this aesthetic has carried over into the digital world.

With fonts copying nearly everything where art is present, typefaces have managed to breathe life into the works we put out and the texts we write.

Also, check out our blog on the best free tattoo fonts for artistic designs.

Let’s go over the best tattoo fonts for women available online today!

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Tattoo Fonts for Women you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

15+ Stylish Tattoo Fonts for Women in 2025

1. Chica Script Font 

Chica is an elegant tattoo script that’s intentionally designed to highlight words you want to keep on your skin forever!

Available in both uppercase and lowercase letters, this stylish tattoo font bundle should make it easier for you to convey whatever message you want to put out.

We liked how this font pack includes 20 ligatures, a bonus “swashes” font, and three tattoo illustrations.

The illustrations come in vector and PNG files while the swashes are in a folder as individual PNG files. Not to mention, it’s very easy to install and use!

2. Strong West – Retro Tattoo Font

Strong West does a fantastic job sporting a strong headline aesthetic, while also doubling as a striking retro tattoo font.

Featuring serifs and added decorative elements, this beautiful font bundle tops our list of the best tattoo fonts for women.

Once inked, consider using tattoo photography to capture the fine lines and feminine flair of this font, this helps you preserve and share that design beautifully.

Depending on your project’s theme, you can also use this font for logos, headers, posters, and other designs that demand attention.

Within the font pack, you’ll find uppercase letters, numbers, punctuation marks, and comprehensive multilingual support.

3. BRADWICK – Tattoo Font

BRADWICK is another stellar font bundle that doesn’t stray too far from Strong West. Referred to as a vintage sailor font, not only is this a great tattoo font, but it’ll also work effectively as a signage and headline.

It’s been optimized for large projects as well so we enjoyed using this for posters, billboards, and more.

While the letters are all capitalized, this tattoo font pack also includes numbers and punctuation marks. It’s easy to install and is compatible with both Mac and Windows too.

We were able to access this font through Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and Microsoft Word.

4. Puerto Playful Tattoo Font

Puerto is a playful font bundle with decorative elements, making it a great visual solution for a variety of things–tattoo-inspired or not.

Though it only has uppercase letters, this font’s style makes it more flexible than most tattoo fonts in our list.

As a tattoo-inspired font, it carries those aesthetics but it’s not dedicated to those either. Hence, we consider it suitable for any theme as the font for a logo, poster, branding effort, advertisement, and more.

5. Buttercake | Monoscript font

A dainty script font bundle, Buttercake does a tremendous job of keeping an amicable aesthetic while remaining classy and versatile.

Packed with uppercase and lowercase letters, alternates, numbers, and punctuation marks, this pastry-inspired tattoo visual is perfect for more than just your everyday headline.

We found it simple to install this font pack on Mac and Windows. It features multilingual support for 16 languages and is provided in TTF, OTF, and WOFF formats.

Furthermore, we enjoyed using this font for posters, logos, banners, t-shirts, packaging, magazines, and more. It’s a stylish and versatile font that’s suitable for a wide range of projects.

6. Desirable Calligraphy

Tons of calligraphy-centric tattoos are all the rave today, and Desirable Calligraphy is proof of that.

Loaded with multi-lingual supports, this beautiful font bundle is apt for several design projects.

From marketing to personal efforts, the list is long with what you can do here.

7. Reina Neue

Are you looking for a font pack that has a lot to offer? Reina Neue provides bang for your buck.

With over 40 elegant serifs to choose from, it’s nearly impossible to still not find what you’re looking for here.

8. Fire Needle – Tattoo Parlor Label Font

Fire Needle is another terrific pick. Referred to as a vintage label font, this serif-like bundle comes with uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as numerals and punctuation marks.

Great for art cards, quote cards, and social media materials, this tattoo-inspired aesthetic is a versatile contender.

9. STRATES VINTAGE TATTOO FONT

One of the more aesthetically pleasing options on the list is STRATES VINTAGE.

Sporting heart-like curves in the middle section of each character, this contender is perfect for more than just tattoo-inspired ideas.

From headlines and marketing materials to branding efforts and creative projects, there are plenty of things you can do with this pick.

10. Just Cosmic Font + Logos

Just Cosmic is an elegant serif font that sports beautiful ligatures and swashes.

Perfect for one-word tattoo ideas, this tasteful font offering comes with capital and small letters, making it a great option for plenty of designs and projects.

11. La Pirata – Vintage Tattoo Font

La Pirata is a playful tattoo-inspired font option.

Also packing mid-section decorative elements, this pretty tattoo font isn’t only a spectacular tattoo font option, but it’ll make for a great aesthetic for marketing materials and signages too.

12. Displaying Bad Luck

It may be called Bad Luck, but the only karma we’re sensing here is fortune and good vibes!

An old-school tattoo display type font, this all-uppercase font offering is a feast for the eyes!

13. Bad Sailor Typeface

We can’t get enough of vintage-like font bundles, and Bad Sailor should help prove that.

A terrific tattoo font inspiration, this decorative contender is approbated for plenty of designs too!

From quote tattoos to advertising efforts, this pick’s a keeper!

14. Lordish Blackletter

Who says blackletter fonts are for men only? Lordish is every inch a black letter font but with a classy twist!

Part medieval and part serif, this beautiful typeface is a combination of plenty of elements!

It comes in 3 weights, too, ensuring that you can pick whatever is best for your project or tattoo!

15. Tattoo God

In the mood for a wavy aesthetic? Tattoo God makes great use of a handwritten font.

Stylishly designed to highlight capital letters, there are also plenty of designs you can complete with this option!

16. Wildstyle – Chicano Tattoo Font

Wildstyle is a bold and elegant font that perfectly captures the essence of Chicano tattoo art with a stylish flair.

Featuring decorative swashes and calligraphic details, this versatile font is ideal for tattoo-inspired logos, headlines, posters, and other eye-catching designs.

The font pack includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, punctuation, and multilingual support, along with unique swash and alternate styles for added creative possibilities.

Stylish & Pretty Tattoo Fonts for Women Summary

Tattoos are cool regardless of what others say about them. At the end of the day, getting tattoos is just another form of self-expression, especially if it doesn’t horribly affect your daily life.

If you end up getting yourself inked with any of the fonts we listed in this feature, let us know!

All in all, the best tattoo fonts for women are stellar finds, each designed to help bring out a statement. Whatever message, idea, or story you want to tell the world, we hope our roundup of all of the best picks in the category helps streamline your search!

What’s your favorite font bundle here? Share it with us in the comment section!

Frequently Asked Questions

How to find the perfect tattoo font?

To find the perfect tattoo font, consider the message and style you want to convey, ensure legibility, and think about size and placement. Simplicity often works best, and consulting a tattoo artist can ensure lasting results.

Is lettering a tattoo style?

Lettering is a tattoo style and one of the oldest forms of tattooing. It's popular for its ability to transform meaningful words or phrases into permanent art, allowing personal expressions to be beautifully inked onto the skin.

Can tattoos be classy?

Yes, tattoos can be classy, though "classy" is subjective. Opt for clean, minimalist designs or black-and-grey styles, and choose a skilled artist who excels in precision and aesthetics to create a timeless, sophisticated tattoo.
